Race.FullText: Shall the Parish of St. Martin, State of Louisiana (the "Parish"), incur debt and issue bonds to the amount of not exceeding Twenty-Five Million Dollars ($25,000,000), to run not exceeding twenty (20) years from date thereof, with the interest at a rate of not exceeding seven per centum (7%) per annum, for the following purposes: (i) $20,000,000 for acquiring, constructing and improving drains, canals, pumps, pumping plants, dykes, levees and other drainage works within and for the Parish and (ii) $5,000,000 for acquiring, constructing, improving and equipping parks, playgrounds, recreation centers and other recreational facilities, title to which shall be in the public, which bonds will be general obligations of the Parish and will be payable from ad valorem taxes to be levied and collected in the manner provided by Article VI, Section 33 of the Constitution of the State of Louisiana of 1974 and statutory authority supplemental thereto, with no increase in the estimated millage rate to be levied in the first year of issue above the 4.41 mills levied in 2015 to pay General Obligation Bonds of the Parish?

Race.SpecificTitle: Sub-Road Dist. No. 3 of Road Dist. No. 1 -- 5.09 Mills - PC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Sub-Road District No. 3 of Road District No. 1 Proposition
(Millage)
Race.FullText: Shall Sub-Road District No. 3 of Road District No. 1 of the Parish of St. Martin, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy a special tax of five and nine hundredths (5.09) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the District (an estimated $62,994 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of constructing and improving public roads and highways within the District, or for the maintenance thereof, said tax being the extension of a millage levied for identical purposes that expired in 2015?

Race.SpecificTitle: Water & Sewer Commission No. 1 -- 7.80 Mills Renewal - BOC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Water and Sewer Commission No. 1 Proposition
(Tax Renewal)
Race.FullText: Shall St. Martin Parish Water and Sewer Commission No. 1, State of Louisiana (the "Commission") levy a seven and eight-tenths (7.80) mills tax (the "Tax") on all the property subject to taxation within the jurisdiction and territorial limits of the Commission (an estimated $174,475 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2017 and ending with the year 2026, for the purpose of acquiring, constructing, improving, maintaining and operating sewers and sewerage disposal works, including the payment of principal and interest on any debt obligations previously issued by Sewerage District No. 1 of the Parish of St. Martin or hereafter issued by the Commission to construct, acquire and improve sewers and sewerage disposal works?
